lead_paragraph: The Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ruled that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey could kill the birds when a plane and its passengers are endangered.
snippet: The Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ruled that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey could kill the birds when a plane and its passengers are endangered.

headline.main: U.S. Appeals Court Allows Killing of Snowy Owls Near Kennedy Airport
headline.print_headline: A Ruling Allows Owls to Be Killed at J.F.K. Airport

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey

abstract: Federal appeals court rules airport officials have right to kill migratory birds if they pose threat to planes at Kennedy International Airport in New York; ruling is defeat for animal advocacy organization Friends of Animals, which filed suit against Port Authority of New York and New Jersey over killing of owls near airport.
